MatchedRegions.transcript: The figure shows how the state of the system is influenced by the instantaneous minima of the energy surface.
The black line VD is slow changing and modulates the minima near the memory states depicted by colored circles.

MatchedRegion.Text: (bottom) The figure shows how the system is attracted to the nearest fixed point from the current state of the energy surface at each point in time.
Point where 57 loses stability and the system is attracted to the basin of 4

MatchedRegions.transcript: VF which are green crosses always follow the instantaneous minima red circle which in turn is modulated by VD.

The resulting system is a two scale time scale dynamical system where in short time scale the system behaves as a static associative memory model attracting to its fixed point while in longer time scales the attractor states can change over time.

MatchedRegion.Text: (bottom) The figure shows how the system is attracted to the nearest fixed point from the current state of the energy surface at each point in time.
